LONG POST ALERT

I ordered a king size bedroom set and was told it would be arriving in 3 1/2 weeks.   The week of delivery I received a phone call from Miguel stating the bedroom set had arrived minus the dresser and mirror.   He went on to say that another set that was similar to the one I ordered was available.   I told him I would come in the store to look at it.  I ordered a grey bedroom. The one that was available was black.   Two different colors.   Told them I would take the one that I ordered and wait for the dresser and mirror.   Day of pick up, load the headboard, footboard and chest.  They tried to get me to sign the paperwork accepting delivery.   Refused because I was missing 2 nightstands and the rails.   They found the rails but no nightstands.   Was told the missing items were in the Mobile store.   I was promised that I would receive the items early Saturday. name: Josh Yates
text:
Overall, I'm satisfied with my purchase at the Montgomery, Alabama location.  Management was very good.  Prices seemed to be excellent.  Quality seemed to be excellent.  Selection was very good.  The -2 star is because of my delivery.  I paid $75 cash for delivery, which is fine.  But, after all my furniture was placed inside my apartment and the delivery men left, I failed to check to make sure everything was delivered correctly.  The next day I open the box that contained my headboard and it was the wrong size and color.  Management had a new headboard delivered to me, but the delivery man refused to take back the incorrect headboard because he said, "I don't have the paper.", so I took the headboard back to the American Freight warehouse.

Within the next few days, I opened the mirror to my dresser and it was the wrong color.  I took the mirror back to the American Freight warehouse and management swapped it out for me.  In the end, I happy with my furniture but it appears my $75 delivery cost was wasted on my end due to the driving back and forth a few times to fix a few mistakes the delivery men made with my purchase.  Before the delivery men leave your location, double check your furniture.

name: Kori Anderson
text:
DO NOT BUY FROM AMERICAN FREIGHT IN MONTGOMERY! They are very unprofessional and unorganized. We bought basically a whole house worth of furniture, when it was time for delivery they informed us that our sectional was not in stock and that it’ll be in stock in 2 weeks and that they’ll deliver it out to us with no delivery fee but we could still get our bedroom suite that we ordered.
Incident #1: On delivery day I had to call and ask what time would the furniture be in because we were out running errands. They forgot to put our furniture on the truck and the delivery people had to come back and get it🙄 (I’m sure if I had not called I would not have known)
Incident #2:Two weeks later, which was on yesterday (Sunday) at around 12pm I called and spoke with OJay and asked was our furniture in. She told me yes(why didn’t they call?) and that they can deliver it out same day. Okay cool. She then called back and said that we didn’t pay all of our delivery fee which in fact when they delivered our furniture the first time my boyfriend gave them the delivery free PLUS A TIP. She then told me that it was okay and that they would take care of it. Later that day, at 4pm, I called again just checking to see what time they would be coming. The guy I spoke with asked would I be okay with getting it delivered first thing Monday morning. Uhh no. (My problem with this was WHY DIDN’T ANYBODY CALL, I would be okay if they had the common courtesy to inform me of any issues instead of me having to call them.) The guy told me my furniture should be at my house no later than 10:45AM(I didn’t know how if they opened at 11am) I asked was he sure and he said yes.
SO THIS MORNING MY FURNITURE WAS NOT AT MY HOUSE AT 10:45! I called promptly AT 11am and spoke w/ the manger Rodney and he informed me that a driver was on the way to get my furniture to deliver it. If my furniture was not able to be at my house at 10:45AM they should have communicated that with me. I received my furniture at 12pm after all the mess I had to go through. I appreciate it if you guys would be more professional with your customers and communicated more with your drivers. I should not have to go through this hassle of getting furniture delivered and I WILL NOT shop with you guys again. Have a good day!!

name: Rachel Bu
text:
TL/DR: furniture took more than 2 months to arrive, company was no help over the phone, leather sectional arrived with corner scuffed. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Full story: I shopped at American Freight on Black Friday 2017 with high expectations after reading these reviews. And the experience in the store was fine. No pressure to buy, but a helpful staff answering any questions my husband or I had. We bought a sectional and ottoman set we liked even though they weren't available for delivery for 2-3 weeks. We were fine with the delay and left looking forward to it arriving in a few weeks (more time to find homes for our old stuff).

That's when the trouble started. Fast forward 4 weeks, no sectional and no call/news at all. I call the store and was told that my purchase wasn't on the truck as expected, but they would be calling other stores to see of they had it and we should hear something the next week.

Life was busy so I didn't check again for another 3 weeks. This time when I called I was told they didn't know why, but it was on back order. But it would for sure be in the next week. I again expressed by hope that it would arrive as I very much looked forward to using my furniture.

2 weeks later, no furniture.  At this point, 2 months after purchasing the furniture and as my husband and I are both active duty military and didn't have the time to go to deal with it, my mother-in-law visited the store on a Friday. She made a bit of a scene stating the facts in front of other customers, and wouldn't you know it our sectional and ottoman arrived on rush order the following Monday. Corners were scuffed in some areas, and a few tears from packing staples, but at that point we were so glad to have the furniture  and tired of dealing with the company that we accepted it anyway. I will never shop there again  and highly recommend you don't either.

name: Wes Stigsell
text:
We decided to shop here due to the great reviews and the quality furniture and a great prices . However the great reviews must be only for furniture that they have in stock. The couch and love seat we really liked was not in stock and we were told it would be two weeks until our furniture would arrive This was 15th of July. It even said August 1st on the sales receipt.  Two weeks go by and we heard nothing. We called American Freight and we were told that they don't have a date that the truck will show up it will just show up one day. Three weeks out we had heard nothing and we're told it would take 2 to 4 weeks. At this point we would of asked for a refund and shopped somewhere else but their policy states you can get a refund after 4 weeks from purchase.  Now four weeks arrives still no furniture still no date a truck will arrive.  We call on Monday with all intentions to ask for a refund and were told there is a truck and the Manger will be in on Thursday for us to get a refund. Thursday comes no phone call from American Freight we call on Friday and we're told oh your couch is here. Alot of effort on our part to find the status on our order. So after 4 weeks and several days of a family of 5 sitting on the floor since we just moved to Montgomery we have our couch and love seat. When we picked them up we told them we were still in the market for furniture and we were told to come back and they will give us a good deal for being so patient  well why not give us a deal while we were there. We won't be back.
Going back to the day we purchased the furniture the couch and love seat we wanted they actually had in the back but it was already sold to a customer who was waiting for it to be delivered some sales people were telling our sales person to just give us that one but we would not do that to someone else. So it puts into question did our furniture arrive weeks ago and they sold it to someone else it's possible especially since they could never give us a date our furniture would arrive.
We do like the furniture but if you shop here and they don't have it in stock BEWARE you will never know when you will get it.

resp.text: We do apologize for the inconvenience, Wes. If there's anything we can do to rectify the situation, feel free to send us an email to social@ameircanfreight.us. Thanks!

name: Sylver Hooks
text: A few months ago, my husband and I purchased a dinette set from this location. When it was delivered, the delivery guy Preston had noticed they sent the wrong chairs but I had noticed the box with the table looked as if it had fallen off of the truck or dropped from a distance. After bringing in the table, they left and came back with the correct chairs. After putting together the chairs, I opened the box containing the table and it had indeed been dropped. It was well after store hours at this point but I still called the delivery guy with my issues. The next morning at 11 sharp, I got a call from the owner. Like he has obviously done before, apologized for it and said that he's send another out by the end of the day. TWO DAYS later, the table finally arrived. They opened the box to make sure that nothing is busted up and I was very pleased with the way it was handled. I was so pleased that we decided to order two more chairs from them. We were told that it took 2 weeks for the chairs to arrive. It was November 27th and we needed them before Christmas. Before they ordered the chairs, we had to pay and that wasn't an issue for us. We paid the full balance of nearly $180 for two Madrid. counter height chairs. Two weeks go by and no chairs. I was told that the truck hasn't come in but I'll definitely have them before Christmas. December 22nd, I gave them another call and I was told that I could pick them up the next day. I was overjoyed to hear that. On the 23rd I got a call from the manager telling me to not come because they wasn't there and he didn't want me to ride there for nothing. He said that he was just have them delivered when they came in. The delivery guy Preston brought to our home at 6pm that night. He told me that they were in a different box because they opened it to make sure that they sent the right chairs because of what happened the first time. Trusting his words, i signed for it then took them upstairs myself. I placed them in a closet, grabbed my things and left home until Saturday night. Christmas morning I pulled out the box, opened it and removed all of its contents. I then took the box to the dumpster. When I returned, I settled myself down to begin assembling the chairs only to find that the chairs HAD ONCE BEEN ASSEMBLED. There were marks on the chairs, the screws were stripped and rusty. and the floor protectors were very worn. There were also four screws missing as well. There were hand smudges all over the wood. There was nothing about those chairs that said NEW. In complete disbelief that Rodney the store manager for charge me full price for two chairs off the showroom floor then have me wait nearly a month to receive them made me a bit irate. Without thinking, I called the store on Christmas morning. After realizing, I messaged the delivery asking for the cell number of the manager and I've yet to receive an response. So as a result, I feel it's very necessary to be waiting in the parking lot with two unassemble Madrid counter height chairs and several questions that gonna require an answer as well as a solution. Until this, I thought very highly of American Freight and its coworkers. Now it's BUYERS BEWARE... there's a reason they say that all sales are finals. For me, I don't want my money back because I do want the chairs. I just want what I paid for and I DID NOT pay for recycled chairs

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear this happened to you, Sylver. If there's anything we can do for you, feel free to email us at social@americanfreight.us. Thanks!

The furniture with the 699 and up prices.

Smh thats not the sofa set we wanted or was discussing.we felt that the salesman wasnt offering us what we wanted but yet offer us what he wanted us to buy.....and we are the customers...its our money not his....we felt like our wants were disreguarded so we decided to check another store, told the guy we were gonna check somewhere else also before we decide. Asked him for a bussiness card and of course he didnt want to give us one and by him doing so gave us even more reason to be absolutely sure that we dont want to shop there now.
So as we started to walk out the door the guy then decided to offer us a deal on a sofa set
...A BETTER PRICE is what he said so im like oh ok he wants to work a deal on the actual leather sofa we were sitting on with the 398 price tax. So im like ok turn around and ask what are you offering...he reply...600 right now walk out..we refused and left and went somewhere else because once agin the guy was still attempting to sale us what he wanted us to buy rather than what we the customer wanted to spend our money on...

name: Krissi Harpel
text: All the reviews were great so I was excited to get started with this company.  Their representative came to the house and brought a contractor, I was told it would take about a week to generate an estimate of materials.  During that week I sent some colors I liked and a couple of questions and I was not getting any response from the designer .  Once the week was up I sent an email to the designer and told her I needed someone who was going to be responsive to emails .  She immediately responded saying that she could not get my cabinets to meet our timeline and I would have to find someone else ...which if she had paid attention I had asked for an estimate on painting and replacing .  I then left a message for someone from management. to call me and got no response.  Very very disappointing

resp.text: I spoke with Krissi and explained a few items to her concerning her project and attempted to assist her with her project even though Coastal is not performing the project.  Hopefully this will help.  We do not paint cabinets and recommend under normal conditions that this not be done.  Typically, a paint job will have to repeated in the near term due to underlying issues with cabinets themselves.

text: For many months my wife and I  have wanted to remodel our bath but finding some one that was knowledgeable and and responsive was impossible and had almost given up. A friend told us to call  Coastal Kitchen & Bath and with in just a few days we were set up to meet and go over what we wanted and measure. The next week we were picking out the flooring, cabinets and fixtures we wanted. Today we have the bath that we had visioned for moths. Very responsive and courteous.

Our website, Facebook page, Pinterest, Google My Business page, etc. all reflect we are open for business and have been open for business. name: ted croft
text: They dont stand behind their products! Bought a marble vanity top and they installed two sinks (undermount) and the silicone bled through to the surface of the top and stained it where the silicone was applied for the sinks. The top is ruined! After sending pics Mike told me to call the manufacturer of the silicone to get it fixed or remedied. What terrible customer service. Good thing he sold the company!

resp.text: Ted is correct, the business has been sold to the owner of Folkers Window Company.  The marble vanity top Ted purchased was a old remnant from the warehouse and was "sold as is" for a very cheap price.  Unfortunately with remnants and very low prices, these things happen.  This was communicated to the customer at the time of the sale.  The best way to avoid issues with products and expired warranties is to purchase new products instead of remnants.

name: Adam Huddleston
text:
We bought a new sofa/loveseat combo from them. The pricetag was certainly lower than anywhere else we looked, and it looked like OK quality furniture.
Less than 3 weeks after purchase, the sofa literally fell apart. We're pretty normal sized people and have treated it with care. I turned it over and opened up the upholstery to have a look.  The construction quality is the worst I've ever seen; low grade partical board, half-rotted knotty 1/2" thick pine, and the whole thing is held together with staples.  I identified 6 separate joints that had come apart inside the couch due to the staples simply slipping out of the wood, and many more that were halfway undone.
I ended up taking around 3 or 4 hours and meticulously replacing pieces, reinforcing joints with metal brackets and screws, and closing up places in the upholstery which were mysteriously split and leaking stuffing.

The furniture here is truly of the lowest quality, even if it appears fine on the surface.  If you buy from here, make sure you also purchase their ridiculously expensive warranty (that will tack on $100 - $200 to your purchase), because you're gonna be needing it a whole lot.  If you need cheap furniture, go to the thrift store or use Facebook marketplace. If you want new furniture, spring for something more expensive.

name: Givon Wayne Gilliam
text:
We bought a floor model and learned a valuable lesson. The couch with chase looked great on the showroom floor and we were very excited to get what we thought was a good deal.

In less than a year the cushions started to shred.  We do not have children and very few guests.  We are very gentle on our furniture.   To our dismay and surprise the couch covering started to disintegrate before our very eyes.   The middle cushion does not even get used at all and it was the first one to split and fray. See photo for what your couch will look like if you buy it from American Freight.

We took the cushions into the store thinking they would honor a 1 year warranty.  Unfortunately because the couch was a floor model it was an “as-is”purchase  and we were out of luck.  American Freight said that there was nothing that they could do.

Here is a warning for you.  If you decide to purchase a floor model, do not be surprised if it does not last one year.  You are buying disposable furniture.  Lesson learned.

name: Amy Thompson
text:
Bought (and financed) two matching recliners on July 21st of 2018. The Helena store only had one so we picked up the other from the Trussville location. Get home to find the Trussville store had given us a broken chair. We return it to the Helena store a few days later and were told they would have to order it and it could take up to 3 weeks to receive the replacement.
We have been very patient, probably to patient...Because here we are 5 months later paying on a chair/recliner that we don't have!
Through these past 5 months there have been countless attempts to reach out to the Helena location, only to be blown off by staff that insist they are oblivious to what is going on and leave me with, "I will have to call you back."
Never to be heard from again until the next time I call or reach out via the American freight website.
This situation has gone on entirely long enough! I personally do not suggest doing business with this company and if you so choose to, just remember, "buyer beware!"

name: Lucas Gambino
text: We hired this company to remodel our kitchen. We did not have much knowledge about these types of projects, so we really needed someone who could provide us with insight and direction. This company was everything we could have asked for. They provided a step-by-step instructions on how to think about our remodel project, and offered continuous support and great ideas along the way. We never felt like we were asking too many questions. They were extremely easy to work with. We receive personal attention from the owner and his wife. And even better than the service perhaps was the great price.  We receive tremendous value and would hire them over and over again. After having looked around before hiring them, I feel confident that there is no other kitchen remodel company in the state that is even close on service, price or quality.

name: Aaron Waters
text: I have purchased appliances from European Kitchens of Alabama twice and would not hesitate to purchase again.  Loay and May are tremendous to deal with and have always put our needs above theirs.  I cannot say enough good things about them.

My spouse is an Architect and works with him a lot because he’s awesome and so is the business!

name: Cheryl Smith
text: My husband and I went by Furniture and Mattress warehouse at the suggestion of my parents. They had a good experience with the owner/manager Josh Johnson so we decided to check the store out. Our visit went great, we ordered a Stearns and Foster mattress, a couch, and a chair. $1500 including delivery. Josh told us he would be going out to Atlanta the following Thursday, February 2nd, to pick up our couch and chair and have it delivered Friday or Saturday. He'd call to set up the final details. The mattress, however, he could get to us by Monday the 30th. We set up a delivery time for 3:00. Josh stated he would call me the morning of the 30th as a reminder. Up to this point, everything was great. Until Monday the 30th rolls around, it's 3:00 and there's no reminder phone call or delivery person. I call Josh and he asks if the delivery could be changed to 5:00. OK. Fine. No problem. Five o'clock rolls around. Nothing. Six o'clock. Seven o'clock. Finally, after being stood up repeatedly, my husband (the second of the two men delivery...That we paid for) helped Josh load the California-king mattress into the house. My husband is a disabled veteran and large part off his disability is his back. It is now the 9th of February and we have not received a single phone call from Josh about our couch and chair. I've called him nine times. Once while standing in front of him yesterday. He informs me that their number has changed as of that morning. Mine hadn't. He never called me. Though it expressly states, via their own contract, that if there are any shipping or delivery set backs they will contact me immediately to let me know. So, on Monday, February 6th my husband goes to the store to inquire as to what is going on. Josh tells my husband that they're having some delivery issues but we'll definitely have our furniture by Friday. He'd be giving us a call to set up a time. However, by Wednesday afternoon still no call. So, I went to the store Wednesday afternoon and Mr. Johnson tells me that we 'should' have our furniture by Tuesday. When I asked him why he hadn't kept me informed he said he was busy keeping up with his other customers and if he neglected to call he was sorry. I asked him why he hadn't returned my calls when the number has only recently changed. Surely he got them. No. He says he never got a single one of the many phone calls I made. Then I ask him if he has my number. He says he wrote it down wrong. That's funny, because he knew it when he was talking to my husband, and it's clearly written in our contract/receipt. Oh. And he tells me they're getting out of the furniture business. Be WARY, folks. Be VERY wary. All I'm asking for is common courtesy. Keep me in the loop. I'm not unreasonable. At this point, however, if I do not receive my furniture by this Tuesday I will proceed to take civil action through litigation if I am not given a full refund of the cost of the delivery fees, couch, and chair that I have paid.

name: EVERYTHING CHILDERS
text:
On Tuesday, my last shopping Pier 1 businesses ended in Jones Valley.
Gave both locations great support.  However...the Jones Valley stop CSR's had been polite & answered questions...but wouldn't help gather my large quantity of items. I had to gather, lift, & carry them.
Following Spine & Hip injections, this was strain to my back & painful. Afterwards, I struggled walking. The associate permitted me to use their plastic cart. After leaving, I was complaining to myself, as I crossed the street to my car. A lady, carrying Bath & Body bag, crossed as well. I commented about the associates at the store being lazy.
As that person went on. I loaded my things & was leaving the cart on the grass.  The lady in the parking area yelled & demanded I return the cart. I didn't fully understand. So, I asked again what she said. She made her demand on me about 3 times.
I asked her if she worked there? She said yes.  I asked if she was a Manager? She said Yes!
I tried to tell her about the laziness I was dealing with.
She became irritated with me. No peaceful problem solving was enacted.
She came hurriedly at me. I asked her to stop. I warned her, she was crossing the line.  She came anyways, within inches of me, calling me lazy, grabbed my cart without my permission, & proceeded to the store, being loud, calling me lazy repeatedly, & told me to never step foot in her store again!
She definitely broke the Covid rules, & came to close to me besides, causes me to feel uncomfortable.
I requested the 911 service & filed a report.
The Manager, should have been more professional.  She ordered me to never come back & she don't have to worry.  I don't want to!!!
All I can say is remember when shopping at the Jones Valley location, to take help for you, because they are not much help.  And watch out for the Quick Tempered Manager.
It's 4 AM & my Spine & hip still hurt.  This  is a shame!
🥺😢

name: Joshua Trotter
text: Was not able to purchase my items. Store did not have sufficient change for my transaction so I was told to come back at a later date. So what your telling me is that it is two weeks before Christmas, the store has been open for several hours and you don't have change for a hundred dollar bill? Why would you even open up for business without change to operate with? How many other paying customers were unable to make a cash purchase?  Staff was rude and the store manager would not even come out of the back room to talk with me? Good luck Pier 1...

text: We will not be back or recommend this place to anyone. When we got there the lady helping us really didnt seem to want to help us. We picked out a couch and they were trying to talk us into getting it a different day bc the loading or  delivery guys were not there. I told her my husband and I would load it bc we wanted it that day. They still wanted us to let them deliver  2 days later. It was getting close to closing time but we ran home got our trailer, loaded it and was pulling out of the parking lot at the exact time they were closing. 4 people helped us with the cushions but it was more like to get us gone. We paid over 1,000 and hate the couch. The cushions have to be adjusted EVERY TIME u sit on it.

I didnt however like the fact, the finance part of it was a surprise. And i will pay off early due to it being on a card and not really thru shumake or a local finance company. And my downpayment ended up being more than i wanted to place down, that should of factored in during financing.
